data.title: Mr Eugenides after the Burning of Smyrna: George Seferis and The Waste Land
data.meta_description: A.E. Stallings is an American poet who studied Classics at the University of Georgia and Oxford. She has published four collections of poetry, Archaic Smile, Hapax, and Olives, and most recently, Like, a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize. She has published three verse translations, Lucretius's The Nature of Things (in rhyming fourteeners!), Hesiod's Works and Days, and an illustrated The Battle Between the Frogs and the Mice. A selected poems, This Afterlife, is just out from FSG in the US and Carcanet in the UK.
data.text: Mr Eugenides after the Burning of Smyrna: George Seferis and The Waste Land
